text: Is anyone else experiencing trouble with Design Manager not being able to save your code??? For the past 20 or so minutes i have not been able to save and publish my code, i got first internal error and now it says Failed to save. My internet connection and speed are both stable and optimal
<@U79N5J2AU>: Can you share code screenshot. May be a syntax error that's the reason giving a internal error.

First, don't use the JQuery that you can enable within HubSpot. It is ancient. Tagging off the above comments, here's code you could use to check if JQuery is set or not already, and if not, load it (specify the version you want in the URL):

`{% if not site_settings.include_jquery %}`
    `<script>`
      `if (typeof jQuery == 'undefined') {`
        `{{ require_js("<https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js>", "head") }}`
        `{{ require_js("<https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery-migrate/3.3.1/jquery-migrate.min.js>", "head") }}`
      `}`
    `</script>`
    `{% endif %}`

Woah, just struck this problem too. Do you know if this is still the case, that custom quotes cannot use dropdown property labels? only internal values? Trying to think now of a workaround other than hard coding all the labels into the template :(
